newsitem.title: ZAIRE: ZAIRE TELLS REUTERS REPORTERS, CNN PRODUCER TO GO.
newsitem.headline: ZAIRE TELLS REUTERS REPORTERS, CNN PRODUCER TO GO.

text.p: Zaire's Information Ministry withdrew the accreditation of four Reuters journalists and a producer for the U.S.-based television company Cable News Network on Thursday and told them to leave the country.

Bagalama Ka Yange, the top civil servant at the ministry, told Reuters the government had decided on the move because certain airline flights to Kinshasa had been cancelled because of information published by Reuters or broadcast by CNN.
"You have violated the accreditation guidelines," he said, adding that those involved should leave Zaire on Thursday.

The Reuters journalists involved are East Africa Bureau Chief Nicholas Kotch, West Africa correspondent John Chiahemen, William Wallis who works for Reuters and the British Broadcasting Corporation, and photographer Howard Burditt. The CNN producer is Robert Wiener.
